snippet.textDisplay:
An excellent video. I remember when the news was called the "news service". They reported facts, not opinions. Now it is effectively the multi billion dollar "news industry". An industry makes a product and seeks to profit from it's marketing of said product. No different than a car salesman, a price drop at Walmart or tea cozy on Etsy.
I think what this virus has done is to show the little talked about world of elder care in this country. In 2016 I had to choose a nursing home for my terminally ill father. I visited six in my immediate vicinity and it was an appalling and eye opening experience. Some of these facilities were right out of a Stephen King novel. I won't get into the specifics but basically, our society takes its elderly and stores them away out of sight with very poor care, unqualified staff and "care givers" who could care less. I've seen more enthusiastic employees at Walmart. If the 18 deaths related to the care facility in Washington hadn't happened, this country would have 6 total deaths from Coronavirus, as of this writing.
Let's get a grip people. We are better and smarter than this. At least we should be.

snippet.textDisplay:
Ok about fear: yes people will fear, and some more than others.
I am fearful about this virus, I am sane. I am a retired engineer
with more understanding of mathematics than most of Congress,
and THAT is why I am afraid. This outbreak is likely to be exponential,
that is it will double case count every few weeks and then every few days.

Of course if when watching testimony before Congress I was to hear
rational questions from our 'representatives' about the spread of Corona,
then maybe I would have some basis to relax. But no, no relaxing here.
People - what matters here is this: We, that is all of us, must take
measures to protect ourselves. Hand washing, no handshakes, cough into
your arm, etc. That information is out there. BUT the why do this is
not always clear. Yes doing these things will make less likely contraction
of the disease but you are likely to get it anyway eventually. So why behave?
BECAUSE taking protective measures will SLOW the transmission to others.
Doing so will allow the heath care providers to take care of all of us
rather than overloading the entire health care system and making it
impossible to effectively manage.

The response to Corona in the USA has not been adequate. In the months and
years to come the story will be picked apart analyzed, and politicized, until
some other story displaces it and those of us who remain grow tired of hearing
about it. I may live and I may die, but I want my children and grandchildren
to thrive. I'd like to see this country turn from its banal fascination with
the idiot in the White House, to one where people come first. A country where
citizens are for their neighbors not against them, where science not opinion
is not only recognized but also held in high regard.

I'd like to see us move beyond kindergarten citizenship toward full
Citizens of Rational Thought.

snippet.textDisplay:
The problem with experts now is that some like the once from WHO pander to China, so it’s not like I disbelieve what they say when they present appropriate studies, it’s more like asking “well what are you trying to conceal”.
And it’s not a stretch to assume they do because of the track record of how China and it’s endorsed entities handled it.
For example, doctors are saying reinfection has a low chance despite them saying:
-we don’t develop immunity to COVID19
-symptoms get worse because it damages the immune system
-it’s highly contagious
So is it that weird to ask what they base their public statements on? I would think with a large sample size like in China that they could easily give a study about reinfection, otherwise I will take this virus as an HIV of sort that works in stages until that’s disproven.
Better be safe than sorry but than again my comment is not designed to raise panic, it was already demonstrated that first time infected that are younger than 60 will most recover from it, question is what if they get reinfected, so basically I demand that health organizations and representatives stop the politics and focus on their field because it seems some forgotten what their job actually is

snippet.textDisplay: Lets not panic but make smaller reasonable adjustments in our lives. I am 69 yrs old and my wife 75. My approach: 1) Limit unnecessary get togethers, especially in large crowds. This means no parties, movie theaters, no hobby activities that involve large numbers of people such as craft shows and train shows, volunteer work at museums etc. postpone travel plans until we know more, no public transportation if possible. 2) Shop in brick and mortar stores as little as possible stores and make as few trips as possible to the grocery stores.   3) Financially make sure we have enough liquid cash to see us through the next 2 years without needing to sell assets 3) Think of this as an opportunity to pursue hobbies and interests such as quilting, photography, and bicycle riding, home improvement, organizing, business interests, and investing, viewing movies and reading, not involving large numbers of people. You know those things you always need and wanted to do but never could find the time to get them done.

snippet.textDisplay:
COVID19 is not "mild", it is a virus, period, and whether it kills fewer people than other viruses is beside the point. COVID19 causes death in people who are immunocompromised. This is, of course, a reason for concern, as in South Africa alone, there are millions of people who are immunocompromised.

For example, people who have TB and/or HIV and don't adhere to their respective treatments (or those not on treatment), or people from poor communities (with poor water and sanitation systems) and a lack of nutritious food. Thus, COVID19 could be disastrous in South Africa.

Moreover, people who are infected without serious symptoms have the ability to infect other people who are immunocompromised. Needless to say, this can also be disastrous. In this view, COVID19 is, in fact, a major public health concern as the World Health Organization declares.

However, if you have not travelled overseas in the last week or more, and have not been in contact with people who did travel, then you have extremely low risk at this stage. Similarly, if you are otherwise healthy, your risk is low too, possibly even zero. Practice good hygiene. So you don't have a need to panic or stock up on any items, as the world is not ending, we just have a virus at hand that needs to be contained.

#COVID19
#DrMaarman
